channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Barrier being built around besieged Sudan city, satellite images show
item.description: The earthen berm is intended to trap people inside el-Fasher, Yale University research shows.

item.title: The death of 'soul of South African storytelling' sparks grief and anger
item.description: Actress Nandi Nyembe's final months were marked by money problems that threatened to overshadow her career.

item.title: US court rules many of Trump's global tariffs are illegal
item.description: The tariffs can remain in place until mid-October to allow the Trump administration time to request the Supreme Court take up the case.

item.title: Protesters and police clash after death of taxi driver in Indonesia
item.description: Tear gas and water cannons are used on protesters as demonstrations erupt across the country.

item.title: Bones found in search for father accused of killing 3 daughters
item.description: The FBI said it found bones while searching for signs of Travis Decker. The bones were being analyzed to determine if they are human or animal.

item.title: Judge blocks Trump admin. from expanding fast-track deportations nationwide

item.title: 8/29: CBS Evening News
item.description: Small businesses warn Trump's import change will drive up prices; 9-year-old boy opens a "compliment stand" to boost people's self esteem

item.title: Trump's rebuke, Xi's handshake, Putin's oil: India's foreign policy test
item.description: India’s foreign policy sits uneasily in the Trump-led order, caught between Russia and strained US relations.

item.title: 8/29: The Daily Report
item.description: Nancy Chen reports on a court's ruling that President Trump's tariffs are illegal, former Vice President's protection detail being revoked, and more.

item.title: Appeals court rules many of Trump's tariffs are illegal, but doesn't halt them
item.description: A federal appeals court said many of the tariffs imposed by President Trump on dozens of countries earlier this year are not legally permissible, but ...

item.title: 'There is no message': The search for ideological motives in the Minneapolis shooting
item.description: The FBI is calling the attack at a Minnesota Catholic church an act of domestic terrorism driven by "hate-filled ideology." Extremism analysts say the...

item.title: With newly approved maps in Texas, GOP puts its gains with Latinos to the test
item.description: President Trump and Republicans made big inroads with Hispanic voters in Texas last year. Now, a newly approved redistricting plan will test whether t...

item.title: COVID vaccine guidance has changed — again. A doctor tackles your questions
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration approved the next round of COVID-19 vaccines, but they come with restrictions. NPR wants to know your questions about...

item.title: At Trump's urging, Missouri jumps into redistricting race to help Republicans

item.title: Father of boy killed in Minneapolis church shooting: Remember his love, not the violence

item.title: Minneapolis Catholic schoolchildren listened to a prayer, then ducked for cover from gunfire
What we know about the shooter who killed 2 and wounded 18 in Minneapolis
